item.title: 交易日：股市暴跌雪上加霜，日本摇摆不定
item.description: 周二，科技股引发的全球股市大跌加速，美国劳动力市场指标疲软也拖累了华尔街，而日本的财政忧虑则拖累日本股市、债券和日元走低。【原文：The tech-induced selloff across global stocks accelerated on Tuesday and soft U.S. labor market indicators also weighed on Wall Street, while fiscal worries in Japan helped drag Japanese stocks, bonds and the yen lower.】

item.title: 特斯拉获得亚利桑那州运输网络公司运营许可
item.description: 美国亚利桑那州交通部周二表示，特斯拉已获得在亚利桑那州作为运输网络公司运营的许可。【原文：Tesla has received a permit to operate as a transportation network company in Arizona, the state's Department of Transportation said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 在最新一轮融资中估值 200 亿美元
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 周二表示，它在一轮 8 亿美元的融资中获得了 200 亿美元的估值，数字市场公司继续吸引投资者的关注。【原文：Crypto exchange Kraken said on Tuesday it was valued at $20 billion during an $800 million funding round, as digital market firms continue to draw investor focus.】

item.title: L3Harris 将投资 4 亿美元扩大阿肯色州的固体火箭发动机生产
item.description: 国防供应商 L3Harris 科技公司周二表示，将投资 4 亿美元在阿肯色州新建一个固体火箭发动机生产园区，这是美国几十年来最大的此类扩建项目之一。【原文：Defense supplier L3Harris Technologies said on Tuesday it will invest $400 million in a new solid rocket motor production campus in Arkansas, marking one of the largest such expansions in the U.S. in decades.】

item.title: 惠而浦在专利纠纷中起诉阻止三星和 LG 微波炉进口
item.description: 惠而浦周二要求美国贸易机构阻止进口和销售韩国和中国竞争对手生产的微波炉，称这些微波炉抄袭了惠而浦的专利技术。【原文：Whirlpool on Tuesday asked a U.S. trade agency to block the import and sale of microwaves from rival manufacturers based in South Korea and China, alleging they copied its patented technology for over-the-range models.】

item.title: 美国为三里岛反应堆重启向星座公司贷款 10 亿美元
item.description: 特朗普政府周二表示，已向星座能源公司（Constellation Energy Corp）贷款 10 亿美元，用于重启宾夕法尼亚州一座核反应堆，这座核反应堆的前身是三哩岛核电站。【原文：The Trump administration said on Tuesday it has loaned Constellation Energy Corp $1 billion to restart its nuclear reactor at a Pennsylvania plant formerly known as Three Mile Island.】

item.title: Kering 首席执行官 de Meo 在备忘录中表示，Kering 必须缩减规模、减少 Gucci 风险并追求协同效应
item.description: Kering 首席执行官卢卡-德-梅奥（Luca de Meo）在路透社看到的一份备忘录中表示，Kering 要恢复增长，就必须减少对陷入困境的旗舰品牌古驰（Gucci）的依赖，进一步缩减门店网络，并寻求更多的协同效应。【原文：Kering's return to growth will require reducing its reliance on struggling flagship Gucci, further scaling back its store network and chasing more synergies, Chief Executive Luca de Meo said in a memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 精神航空工会同意空姐和飞行员减薪
item.description: 代表美国精神航空公司飞行员和空乘人员的工会周二表示，他们已与该公司就减薪和福利问题达成协议，因为该航空公司正在进行破产保护重组，试图控制成本。【原文：The unions representing Spirit Airlines pilots and flight attendants said on Tuesday that they have reached an agreement with the company for pay and benefits cuts as the carrier tries to rein in costs as part of its ongoing Chapter 11 restructuring process.】

item.title: 巴西零售商 Magazine Luiza 和 Americanas 宣布建立电子商务合作伙伴关系
item.description: 巴西零售商 Magazine Luiza 和 Americanas 周二宣布建立电子商务合作伙伴关系，双方将开始在对方的零售平台上销售各自的产品。【原文：Brazilian retailers Magazine Luiza and Americanas announced an e-commerce partnership on Tuesday and will each start selling their products on the other's respective retail platform.】

item.title: 人工智能贸易和降息疑云令市场下滑，投资者神经紧绷
item.description: 在市场破纪录涨势的两大支撑点--人工智能交易和降息预期--面临考验之前，美股数月来最大的回调正在刺激投资者的神经。【原文：The biggest U.S. stocks pullback in months is fraying investors' nerves ahead of tests to two underpinnings of the market's record-breaking rally: the artificial intelligence trade and expectations for interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 法官裁定美国各州可介入 HPE 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络一案
item.description: 一位法官在本周二的听证会上表示，美国一些州可以介入惠普企业公司以 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）的案件，美国司法部已提议达成和解，让该交易继续推进。【原文：A group of U.S. states can intervene in a case over Hewlett-Packard Enterprise's $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks , which the U.S. Department of Justice has proposed to settle and let the deal move forward, a judge said during a hearing on Tuesday.】

item.title: Meta 首席营收官赫格曼离职创办初创公司
item.description: Meta 公司首席营收官约翰-赫格曼（John Hegeman）周二表示，他将离开 Facebook 母公司，创办自己的初创公司，这标志着这家社交媒体公司在追求超级智能的过程中发生了关键性的领导层变动。【原文：Meta's chief revenue officer John Hegeman said on Tuesday he will leave the Facebook parent to launch his own startup, marking a key leadership change amid the social media company's pursuit of superintelligence.】

item.title: FDIC 就硅谷和 Signature 银行倒闭反诉 Capital One
item.description: 美国联邦存款保险公司提起诉讼，指控 Capital One 为帮助硅谷银行和 Signature 银行的储户获得救助而支付的金额比其应支付的金额少了近 1 亿美元，这两家银行均于 2023 年倒闭。【原文：The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation filed a lawsuit accusing Capital One of paying nearly $100 million less than it should have to help bail out depositors of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, which both collapsed in 2023.】

item.title: 消息人士称，埃克森公司与雪佛龙公司联手追逐卢克石油全球帝国的部分股权
item.description: 据熟悉内情的消息人士称，美国石油巨头埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil）已加入竞争对手雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp）的行列，考虑收购受制裁的俄罗斯石油巨头卢克石油公司（Lukoil）的部分国际资产。【原文：U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil has joined rival Chevron Corp in considering options to buy parts of sanctioned Russian oil major Lukoil's international assets, sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美国航空集团敦促国会在未来停航期间向管制员支付工资
item.description: 代表美国主要航空公司的行业组织负责人将于周三呼吁，通过确保空中交通管制员和其他主要工作人员的工资，永久性地结束政府关门期间的航空中断。【原文：The head of a trade group representing major U.S. airlines will call on Wednesday for permanently ending aviation disruptions during government shutdowns by ensuring air traffic controllers and other key workers are paid.】

item.title: 特朗普要求吊销美国广播公司的广播执照
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，应该 "收回 "沃尔特-迪斯尼（Walt Disney）旗下美国广播公司（ABC）的附属公司所使用的广播许可证，此前他在椭圆形办公室对该电视台记者提出的一个问题表示了异议。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that broadcasting licenses used by affiliates of Walt Disney's ABC should be "taken away" after he disagreed with a question posed by a reporter for the network in the Oval Office.】

item.title: 大众品牌负责人表示，目前已确保芯片供应
item.description: 大众汽车品牌负责人周二表示，大众汽车已经为其生产获得了足够的芯片，而其他汽车公司仍在为制造商耐克斯公司的贸易争端引发的供应短缺而苦苦挣扎。【原文：Volkswagen has secured sufficient chips for its production, the head of the carmaker's VW brand said on Tuesday, as other automotive firms still struggle with a supply shortage triggered by a trade dispute over manufacturer Nexperia.】

item.title: 特朗普称政府已开始面试下任美联储主席
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二表示，他正在就美联储主席一职与多方人士交谈，在可能接替杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的人选名单上有一些意想不到的候选人。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he was speaking with various people about the Federal Reserve chairman's job and had some unexpected candidates on the list of those who might replace Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 派拉蒙称《综艺》关于华纳兄弟以 710 亿美元竞购 Discovery 的报道 "完全不准确"。
item.description: 派拉蒙天舞公司周二表示，《综艺》杂志关于该公司与沙特阿拉伯、卡塔尔和阿布扎比的主权财富基金组成投资财团，以总价 710 亿美元竞购华纳兄弟发现公司的报道 "完全不准确"。【原文：Paramount Skydance said on Tuesday Variety's report on the company forming an investment consortium with the sovereign wealth funds of Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Abu Dhabi to submit a total $71 billion bid for Warner Bros Discovery is "categorically inaccurate."】

item.title: 致命事故发生后，自由港计划在七月前重启格拉斯贝格铜矿生产
item.description: 自由港麦克莫兰公司（Freeport-McMoRan）周二表示，该公司计划在七个月前恢复印尼格拉斯贝格铜金矿的生产，两个月前的一次致命事故迫使该矿停止运营。【原文：Freeport-McMoRan said on Tuesday it plans to restore production at Indonesia's Grasberg copper and gold mine by July after a fatal incident forced operations to halt two months ago.】

item.title: 特朗普称自己与家族企业 "毫无关系
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二表示，在特朗普集团（Trump Organization）和一家沙特开发商寻求在马尔代夫开设最新一家特朗普酒店之际，他与自己的家族企业毫无关系。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he has nothing to do with his family business as the Trump Organization and a Saudi developer look to open the latest Trump hotel in the Maldives.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定 Meta 收购 Instagram 和 WhatsApp 没有扼杀竞争
item.description: 一名联邦法官周二做出了有利于 Meta Platforms 的裁决，称该公司收购 Instagram 和 WhatsApp 并没有非法扼杀竞争，这是大科技公司在唐纳德-特朗普总统第一任期开始的反垄断打击行动中取得的首次决定性胜利。【原文：A federal judge ruled in favor of Meta Platforms on Tuesday, saying the company did not illegally stifle competition by buying Instagram and WhatsApp, giving Big Tech its first decisive win against the antitrust crackdown started in President Donald Trump's first term.】

item.title: 亚马逊的 Zoox 在旧金山推出机器人出租车服务
item.description: 就在 Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 表示将在同一市场提供机器人出租车搭乘服务的几天前，亚马逊的自动驾驶部门 Zoox 周二在旧金山为用户开放了等候名单，提供免费搭乘服务。【原文：Amazon's self-driving unit Zoox opened its waitlist on Tuesday for users in San Francisco, offering free rides, just days after Alphabet's Waymo said it will provide robotaxi rides in the same market.】

item.title: Waymo 在迈阿密推出全自动机器人出租车，并将扩展到美国其他四个城市
item.description: 本周二，Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 公司开始在迈阿密运营完全自动驾驶车辆，为其打车服务向更多美国城市的扩张拉开了序幕，同时也在努力巩固其在自动驾驶技术领域的领先地位。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo began operating fully autonomous vehicles in Miami on Tuesday, kicking off the expansion of its ride-hailing service to more U.S. cities as it races to cement its lead in self-driving technology.】

item.title: 亚马逊和谷歌被欧盟评为金融业 "关键 "技术供应商之一
item.description: 欧盟监管机构周二指定亚马逊网络服务公司（Amazon Web Services）、谷歌云计算公司（Google Cloud）和微软公司（Microsoft）等 19 家技术公司为该集团金融业的重要第三方计算供应商。【原文：European Union regulators on Tuesday designated 19 technology companies, including Amazon Web Services , Google Cloud and Microsoft , as critical third-party computing providers for the bloc's finance industry.】

item.title: 法国法院驳回起诉雀巢公司 Perrier 矿泉水的案件
item.description: 本周二，法国一家法院驳回了一个消费者团体针对雀巢公司 Perrier 矿泉水提出的诉讼，该消费者团体要求雀巢公司从市场上撤下这种会产生火花的矿泉水。【原文：A French court rejected on Tuesday a case against Nestle's Perrier mineral water brought by a consumers group who demanded the sparking water be withdrawn from markets.】

item.title: 交易者日趋谨慎，比特币跌破 90,000 美元
item.description: 本周二，比特币七个月来首次跌破 90,000 美元，这是整个金融市场投资者风险偏好正在枯竭的最新迹象。【原文：Bitcoin fell below $90,000 for the first time in seven months on Tuesday, marking the latest sign that investor appetite for risk is drying up across financial markets.】

item.title: Allegiant 飞行员在美国机场举行抗议活动，要求加薪和改善航班时刻安排
item.description: Allegiant Air 飞行员周二在美国 22 个机场举行抗议活动，要求提高薪酬和改善航班安排，因为与该航空公司的劳资合同谈判在经过数年谈判后陷入僵局。【原文：Allegiant Air pilots picketed at 22 U.S. airports on Tuesday, demanding higher pay and better scheduling as labor contract talks with the carrier have stalled after several years of negotiations.】

item.title: 消息人士称，埃利奥特增持巴里克矿业公司股份
item.description: 一位熟知内情的消息人士周二称，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已在巴里克矿业公司（Barrick Mining）持有大量股份。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a significant stake in Barrick Mining , a source familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国客运铁路公司 Amtrak 创下乘客人数纪录并减少亏损
item.description: 美国客运铁路公司 Amtrak 周二表示，该公司的乘客人数和收入创下了新的年度纪录，亏损额减少了 15%，降至 5.98 亿美元。【原文：U.S. passenger railroad Amtrak said Tuesday it set a new yearly record for ridership and revenue as it cut losses by 15% to $598 million.】
